source.title: Ten year anniversary charge (post-November 2015 rules) - Joseph's trust

testCase.description: 10-year charge using post-Nov 2015 rules (excludes non-relevant property)
testCase.scenario: Joseph's trust D reaches 10-year anniversary on or after 18 November 2015. Under new rules, non-relevant property is excluded from notional transfer calculation. Trust has £350,000 relevant property.

calculationNotes: For anniversaries on or after 18 November 2015, non-relevant property is excluded
Non-relevant property: EXCLUDED under new rules
Actual charge £9,450 < £21,000, so no capping required
Key difference from pre-2015: Non-relevant property excluded reduces notional transfer
hmrcQuote: Joseph's trust D calculation (on or after November 18, 2015) excluded non-relevant property. The notional transfer was £500,000 with £274,980 nil rate band available. Effective rate: 9.000%, anniversary rate: 2.700%. Tax on £350,000: £9,450.
